title: Well worth a visit
review: The Jain temple can only be visited by those of the Jain religion. However the museum is open to all. There is a nominal entrance fee of 10 rupees. As there are English explanations throughout, you get a good understanding of the religion and the gold miniature creation has to be seen to be believed. An excellent way to spend an hour.

title: impressive modelling and gold work, and symbolic story telling
review: quiet calm, almost empty, cheap admission charge and helpful booklet. well worth an hour of time.A guide would have been really appreciated!

title: Unique and beautiful
review: This Jain temple is a worth visit place. It has very beautiful gold - plated artistic work. It was peaceful and nearly empty. The description of the models and art work was displayed very well. You would not need a guide. Highly recommended.

title: Unexpected beautiful golden sculptures
review: The temple itself is not able to be viewed unless you are a Jain believer.  Access is from  a street corner. The temple caretaker did give us permission to take a photo from the outside.

title: A decent place to visit
review: Also known as Soni Ji ki Nasiya. There is a temple only for Jain people and a museum for all. The museum has a world miniature made from gold. It's a quiet place having very low entrance fee.

title: Brilliant
review: Only believers can enter the temple but exterior is glorious. The real attraction is the Jain model of the universe. Gilded figure, animals and buildings. Quite remarkable.

title: Beautiful temple
review: I was delighted to see this temple.It is a wonderful example of traditional jain temple architecture.

title: Can only visit the Museum not the temple if your not Jain
review: A must see museum next to the Temple, a great work of craftsmanship to create the entire display, check visiting hours.

title: A must visit in Ajmer
review: This is a beautiful recreation of the golden city of Ayodhaya depicting birth of Lord Rishbhavdev and celebrations.

title: A short visit to understand the origins of Jainism
review: Soni ji ki nasiya is situated in the heart of Ajmer city at about 2 kms from the railway station. Can be very easily accessed through public transportation. Entrance fees is 10 Rupees. You need to take off your shoes at the entrance. There is a designated person to take care of your shoes and they charge Re 1 for each pair of shoes.

title: Definitely visit
review: I thought it was quite spectacular.   The whole inside structure was I believe  in  gold life.  I especially lived seeing the floating boats that watched over the earth.

title: Awesome.... must on the list
review: Beautiful crafted temple ...... one of its kind .....kids were also awestruck.....well maintained and do read what’s written on the walls ...

title: Excellent and must see place
review: While in Ajmer on tourism one must visit Nasiyan Jain temple.  Its an imaginary town brought to reality by putting gold plated maniquins .

title: An architectural veritable treasure .
review: Built by a Jain railway contractor in 1858 the temple  recreates the celebration of the birth of Lord Mahavir.There is a marble pillar in the courtyard and figurines of horses ,devotees ,durbans ,Hawa sawaris,and very detailed artwork .When the lights are switched on the entire recreation is magical .The carvings on the ceiling are  marvellous .

title: wonderful experience
review: All Jains must visit this place.. At each city we should prepare a list of important religious places .

title: Indian style of telling stories
review: One of it's own type, this is similar to the Jhanki in North india on Janmashtami ( Lord Krishna birthday). You don't want to leave this place as so much to observe but the down side is the type of tourists are visiting this place, they have carved their names on the walls. Shame on such people.

title: Good Exibit of Jain mythology
review: Good place that has a top floor exhibit. There is a nice description of the Jain beliefs and mythology

title: Gold that glitters
review: After visiting Dargah I went to see gold temple. I will definitely recommend this place to visit. It charge minimal price for entry. You’ll see everything in gold. To visit temple you must be jain to go inside but for visiting gold museum it’s fine if you are not jain. As one of my friend was punjabi he was restricted to visit inside the temple.

title: Fantastic!
review: We visitors during our recent trip to Rajasthan and it was a recommendation from my parents. They mentioned that if you ever wanted and example of “don’t judge a book by its cover”, this is the one. From the outside, it looks pretty ordinary. But once you pay the nominal fee and enter, it is just eye-candy!! And you struggle to come out and will just keep clicking pics. As a bonus, there is a wonderful shop at the entrance that retails fantastic incense sticks and you won’t leave without getting some.

title: Temple
review: The temple is excellent and made with real gold. We enjoyed very much.i wish to tell about this to my friends.

title: MESMERISING - WONDER OF WONDERS
review: it is one of the most beautiful piece of art - unbelievable !!

title: Good place
review: Very good hotel to visit best in ajmer i think  best in class aminities worthy to get  big lawn luxury rooms and much more you need to stay here to feel this  luxury  hotel in ajmer

title: A must see, spectacular
review: Not much to see in Ajmer but a visit to this Jain temple is absolutely worth a short stop. The psychedelic Golden reconstruction of the saint saga is spectacular and unique. You’ll be able to visit this place with only a few other tourists and for a symbolic entrance fee. There are explanations in English. Very recommended

title: Nice jain temple
review: Ultimate, very old jain temple it's quite and peaceful place. Best temple awesome interior like wooden work

title: Heavenly - Must Visit !!
review: Am born and brought up in Ajmer and visiting this place since childhood.

title: Golden temple for jains
review: this as amazing temple with real gold inside in the heart of the city.. must visit place in the Ajmer..

title: History of Jainism; Amazing museum!
review: Do not miss out on this Jain temple, it is one of a kind. The museum has an observatory deck from which you can witness miniatures and structures weaving a story. Each item is made of gold and rubies.

title: Excelent visit
review: This place is amazing if you are at Ajmer or in Pushkar don't miss to see this place.

title: MUST TO SEE
review: Not to miss this place. Will not see this type of minature making of a Palace anywhere in world. Not to miss for 1st time visitor of Ajmer

title: Magnificent architecture of Jains
review: Situated in main city constructed by Seth sir Soniji long back ,a pure gold structure of samosaran is splendidly design of workmanship of art and craft.

title: Divine feeling and calm inside..
review: Since everyone else has already written about the golden models, I would say that visit the place to view the carvings and other sculptures in the temple too. It is very delicate and intricate. Regardless of whether you are Jain or not, it's a great feeling to be here.

title: Marvellous structure
review: This Jain temple is also called "Soniji ki Nasiyan". It houses golden models depicting the Jain concept of Universe and five great events - conception, birth, penance, enlightment, salvation.

title: Sacred Place
review: I went to Nasiyan Jain Temple. Truly one of the best Jain temples in Rajasthan, Nasiyan Jain temple is a prime Digambar Jain sacred site in Ajmer. Nasiyan temple is an excellent example of the ever-so-stunning Jain temples. It is great place to go.

title: Spectacular Art work.. But with no proper view
review: It is a spectular art work. But unfortunately there are no proper view. We have to peep through the meshed windows to get the glimpses.No guide or assistance to explain.

title: Absolutely fantastic art! Mind blown
review: This is one of the most amazing Jain art museum/places of worship I've had the pleasure of visiting. If in Ajmer, this is a must visit.

title: Fine but badly maintained.
review: Being a jain I made sure to visit this place. Temple was grt. Decently maintained but the display of sone ji ke nisiyan  could be better. Should also make place diffrently abled and senior person friendly.

title: My third visit to this temple, after 10 years
review: This Jain temple has an attached "soni ji ki nasiyan" display of golden miniatures, which depicts the life history of first Jain teerthankar (guru). The view of sparkling golden statues in enclosed glass cell is awesome from first floor of the temple.

title: Intricate Golden Model world
review: Its really nice model work . making a golden  model of the Jain Universe .

title: Beautiful
review: This temple come museum is beautifully done and the way it is presented and kept is too good, the entry is not much, its inexpensive but as it is a temple come museum you need to make sure you don’t get eatables inside. Worth a visit!

title: Hidden jewel
review: Soniji ki Nasiyan is a definite worth watch. It is in an old building, while climbing the stairs you wonder what you will be seeing, but once you go there, it is beautiful. Do visit if you go to Ajmer.

title: Surprised to see this place in Ajmer.
review: Won't write much about it as this place is very mysterious and needs a visit to unfold those mysteries. Must buy Gold leaf paintings from this location.

title: Not Worth It! Badly maintained viewing areas. Public making too much noise. Steep steps
review: Had to walk through very dusty and dirty main streets to reach this place. After paying the entry fee my mother found that steps were way to steep and the stairwell too dark to climb safely, so she returned to wait for me. Nothing to see except a model of the universe as the Jains see it and made of gold metal work. Information boards were way too high to read and the crowd was making too much noise. Viewing areas were badly maintained and ill lit. Waste of money energy and time. Just a money making enterprise. Could have used the time to see other places.

title: Good place in Ajmer
review: If one is visiting Ajmer than it is one of attraction which is  at least one time see. One would get idea of Jain culture also.

title: Amazing place
review: This is simply amazing place. You can see the jain culture structure in golden model. You can see the structure outside the glass cover only. This place will not take more than half n hour to visit.

title: Beautiful toys ....dumped?!?
review: On our way from Pushkar to Udaipur, we went to this temple in Ajmer.  As we tried to enter, a watchman at the gate asked us if we are Jains.  When I answered in the negative, he said only Jains could enter the main temple and all the others should enter through the other gate.  On hearing this, another group went away without visiting the temple in spite of the watchman insisting on their visiting the museum.  Well, that's that.

title: Absolutely amazing
review: It's not everyday that we get to see such a beautifully laid out scenery in gold! However don't forget to take a pair of binoculars.they will allow you to enjoy the depicted scenes.

title: amazing
review: amazing jain temple. all temple structure like golden city. the temple r located in mid city. near to rly station and bus stand.

title: Nasiyan Ji
review: Excellent Art work of Jainism. Minutely crafted design of Shri Meru Parvat with Abhishek of Teerthankar Bhagwaan. People who visit Ajmer should not forget to see it.

title: Awesome! Most amazing!
review: I had read about the temple on trip advisor. On my visit to Ajmer, I knew that I had to visit it. We first went to Ana Sagar n from there, we walked up to this nondescript temple. It looks very staid from outside. But as you climb up the stairs...you will be amazed at the marvel before your eyes.

title: Great...
review: It was a great place to visit. Structure and architecture of this temple was amazing. Entry fees was only Rs. 10. It was such a wonderful experience.

title: awesome place and really nice place to visit
review: well according to me this is one of the clean and silent place no noise pollution no traffic and neat and clean place

title: Beautiful place
review: It is known Soni ji ki nasiya it is located near dargah it is a temple of Jain religion in it we found Ayodhya

title: Wonderful concept
review: This beautiful temple is situated in the main city and is very interesting to understand because of the philosophy surrounding it ie the concept of the various worlds within this world and the types of people inhabiting them as per the Jain religion. The context is important to appreciate this beautiful piece of golden architecture.

title: Architecturally Rich Temple
review: This temple is located in the main city and is easily accessible. It is one the best Jain temples in Rajasthan. Its architecture both from outside and inside is amazing. The golden chamber of the temple is one of a kind thing you would witness in any temple. The golden chambers depicts the various stages of the life of Lord Rishabhdev. The place was quite and one can feel the divine sense. The place is very well maintained and clean. The view of Ajmer city from the top of the temple is mesmerising. If you are in Ajmer, keep this jain temple on your list for sure.

title: Beautiful piece of architecture
review: ‘Soniji ki Nasiya’ is one of the most attractive and well built temples to visit in Ajmer. It’s amazing how the gold structures depict the stories of Jainism. The temple is wonderfully designed with great attention to detail and that’s the uniqueness of this place. Anyone who comes to Ajmer should not give this place a miss. The location is perfect. It is peaceful and every corner is impressive. I would highly recommend this place to everyone!

title: Beautifully maintained
review: This temple is really well maintained in terms of everything, be it cleanliness or visitors' organization. Really nice architecure wise also. A must visit place if you are packing your bags for Ajmer. :)

title: Famous Tourist Attraction
review: I went to Nasiyan Jain Temple. This temple is a man-made gem, the perfect example of traditional Jain-style architecture, a real treat to the eyes of the devotees and the tourists. Nasiyan Jain Temple is not only a popular religious spot but is also a famous tourist attraction of Ajmer. It is great place to go.

title: Ajmer for attending DAV college alumni
review: Had a wonderful experience to visit this Jain temple ... the golden plated work attract v. much.... we enjoyed a lot and my son also enjoyed this temple.

title: Awesome - not to be missed
review: It is a world class gold plated display of an ancient Indian city. With a ₹10 entry, it is something that you should not miss in Ajmer.. amazing workmanship on display

title: Beautiful and Unique Jain temple.
review: The entrance gate of the temple is made of red sand stone, so it is also called the red temple.The main temple, which is embellished with the images of the Tirthankars was closed .We later learnt that only Jains are allowed in the main temple.The main attraction is the Swarn  Nagri hall( City Of Gold) or the museum. The entrance fee is very little.People of all religions are allowed there. It is a two storied hall showing architectual model of the city of Ayodhya, constructed in gold, depicting in concentric circles the city according to the Jain religion.The view is same from both floors but second floor gives a complete picture.It is a must see temple in Ajmer,very close to Durgah Shariff.

title: Golden everything, not worth a penny!
review: Didn't liked the place. Shoddily managed and no facilities even after paying the nominal fee. Won't visit again.

title: An old heritage
review: This Temple is situated between Daulat Bag or Aana Sagar lake to Dargaah. You have to take a ticket for inside access. Temple is a hollow property of Jain religion and gives a feel of piece. Many of Jain priests idols are there.

title: Museum
review: Its a beautiful museum with two floors. You need to get a ticket to enter there. Nice art-work is done.

title: beautifully spiritual
review: Beautiful jain temple with a museum  having gold plated  figures representing all phases of a jain tirthankara (god)

title: A different place
review: Nice place to go, if you are interested to know more about Origin of Jainism. Very attractive to see the effort placed in recreating the myth. If you are lucky you can go to the Jain temple from the other side. A nice quite place.No urinals however.

title: Stunning
review: The architecture is absolutely stunnning. The temple is located in the main city, easily reachable, by your own car and public or private vehicle, though look out for the parking space beforehand. The particulars of this temple and worth to give it a shot.

title: Good place - but could have kept open
review: This place is good to see how the Mahabharata was there. The glass was obstructing the view and could have been open with an air con.

title: Jain Temple
review: We just passed by the Jain temple and stopped for a few minutes to go inside. The interiors of the temple are very nicely done. The temple is right on the main road.

title: another golden temple.. this time in Ajmer
review: as you give the entry fee and get into the temple, you will reach a big hall which is protected from all four sides by building glass walls from the verandahs. this large hall consist of many statues, buildings etc made of gold. you can see the same thing from both ground and first floors.. its a must visit place in ajmer.. If I'm right, the ticket per head is 20 and you can finish off the things in maximum 1 hour

title: Nasiyan jain Temple
review: An important temple for the Jain s, it houses in its main hall an architectual model of the city of Ayodhya, constructed in gold, depicting in concentric circles the city according to the Jain religion.. While all visitors are allowed access to this area, only Jains can enter the Main temple.

title: Golden Temple
review: Nasiyan jain temple is beautiful temple of jain. This temple is looks like golden temple. I suggest to everyone must see this location.

title: OUTSTANDING!
review: My wife remembered seeing this place as a kid and we casually stopped by to have a look, and boy were we surprised...it is absolutely breathtaking...this entire world of miniatures is so amazing that you can't  get enough of it....its definitely a must see for all who visit Ajmer.

title: Red Temple
review: Nasiyan Jain temple is beautiful red temple of Ajmer Rajasthan. This is famous Jain temple. Good place.

title: Soni Ji Ki Nasiyan (Golden Temple)
review: I think Soni ji ki Nasiyan is one of the best built Jain temples in the whole of Rajasthan. Also known as the Lal Mandir, it’s dedicated to Lord Adinath and has got some of the most exquisite carvings in gold.  Situated in the center of the town is a beautiful red Jain temple (Digambar), known as Nasiyan.  This temple was built in 1865 and is also famous by the name Golden Temple, due to tis amazing and unique display.  The main double storeyed hall is exceptionally beautiful with gold and silver decorations.  Within the temple there is a splendid display of wooden gilt representations, glass engravings and paintings describing the Jain faith about the creation of the world.  One part of the temple is the worship area comprising the idol of Lord Adinath, while the other forms a museum and includes a hall.  Made of gold, the interior of the museum depicts the five stages (Panch Kalyanak) in the life of Lord Adinath. . Recognised as the Golden Temple (Swarna Mandir), the temple has a focal hall that is embellished with gold and silver decorations. The temple also showcases wooden gild representations, glass engravings and paintings.

title: My wife and I visited the temple on the tour of Rajastan
review: Small temple but lots of golden details for those interested, tells the Jain point of view of the world quite well but everything is glassed over for protection so it is hard to take good photos. The temple is more of a museum to the Jain art.

title: Beautiful place a must visit
review: A beautifully kept place, cant be described in words, though the viewing area needs painting, people have made scratches here and there, not good to visit by older people or who has problem with knees as there are stairs which big as of olden days so hard to climb.

title: Waiting to be discovered by the hordes
review: What beautiful work. 250 artisans worked 25 years to make a remarkable miniature of the Universe as per the Jain scriptures. A definite 'must see'.

title: Superb place
review: The temple has a two-storied structure divided into two parts, where one is the worship area comprising the idol of Lord Adinath and the second is the museum including a hall. The double – storey hall adjacent to the main temple has many idolscovered with gold that has earned the name Golden Temple (Swarna mandir) for it. The hall displays a series of large gold plated wooden figures depicting legends from Jain mythology. The entire hall is richly adorned by glass mosaic, precious stones, gold and silver work. The temple also has splendid paintings.

title: Unique spiritualistic art site
review: This is a small golden coloured 'Jainism Lok' in a hall, artfully demonstrated and protected.. really different from tourist expectations..

title: Nice Jain Temple
review: Everyone Pls visit the nasiya jain temple its really gr8 place in ajmer gold plated animals goddess .

title: A place with difference
review: If you are at Jaipur, this is a place that is not to be missed. You can take an auto from the railway station and it is a short travel. Unlike most other Jain temples, this doesn't have white marble statues of Tirthankaras. Instead its a huge hall filled with glittering golden models of gods and godesses. Quite an attractive sight!

title: Soniji Ki Nasiyan an architectural marvel in Ajmer
review: Soniji Ki Nasiyan also called Ajmer Jain temple is over 100 years old. It has a museum on the second floor which is open to all religions comprising of a main chamber, known as the Swarna Nagari which has several gold-plated wooden figures, depicting several figures in the Jain religion.The temple part is accessible to only jains.The thought to have such model for educational purposes occurred to Seth Moolchand Soni and hence the name Soniji Ki Nasiyan or Red Temple.A must see in Ajmer for unique three dimensional golden models depicting jain conception of universe and five great events of the life of the first Tirathkar of this era.It has a nominal entrance ticket and also a short afternoon break when it is closed.

title: Beutifully intricate
review: The model city made inside the temple complex is outstanding. Its great to see the detailing of the model. Just wish that there was more surveillance of the area as tourist have ruined that walls of the beautiful monument.

title: Mini Marvels..
review: Beautiful gold plated architectural marvel enclosed in glass and tells a story which you can read from the board hanged on the wall.

title: A Digambar Jain Temple
review: The renowned Nasiyan Jain Temple is to be found at Prithviraj Marg in Ajmer, Rajasthan. After the temples of Ranakpur and Mount Abu, Nasiyan temple is regarded as one of the best Jain temples in Rajasthan. Built in 1865, Nasiyan Temple is also known as Lal Mandir (Red Temple). Centrally located in Ajmer, the temple can be reached easily from anywhere in Rajasthan. Nasiyan Digambar Jain Temple is dedicated to Lord Adinath, the first Jain 'tirthankara'.

title: Worth a visit
review: The huge model world inside in the temple is fascinating and beautifully odd. If you're passing through Ajmer I highly recommend taking a visit here and seeing it for yourself.

title: Golden Sprituality
review: What to say about this temple located  at the middle of the city, along with the gold and silver chariots and the architectural design is a delight to watch

title: Lal mandir(Red Temple)
review: This jain temple is dedicated to Lord Adinath who was the first jain 'tirthankara'.The temple is a two storied structure and is divided into two parts.One part of the temple is the worship area comprising the idol of Lord Adinath,while the other forms a museum and includes a hall.

title: Over the top miniature in kinda seperate temple
review: You cannot go in the real Jain tempel, but get a seperate entrance for this piece of perfected miniature of the Jain world. It seems specially made for the tourists. However, the price is not really anything. So okay place to visit. Normally not busy at all.

title: Looks like golden palace
review: This temple having two parts, one is Jain temple.. Only Jain will be allowed in this temple. We have visited Nasiyan temple just behind the main Jain temple. Have lots of architecture design with gold color like chariot and palace.

title: Very peaceful place
review: Jain temple was constructed in 1865.

title: A full city made of gold in glass chambers
review: I liked this place much. Not much crowded and can get clear look at the entire city like structure built of gold. Really good place to visit for art lovers

title: Amazing !!
review: The miniature  temple is an amazing piece of architecture..

title: A golden universe of story telling in miniature
review: Hard to find on foot, best to ask a Tuk Tuk how to get there! The red temple of Nasiyan which is a Jain temple contains a wonder of imagination showing how the Jain religion sees the world. The multi-trunk elephants flying silver bubble deities and the golden mountain are a fantastic and unusual must see if you are in Ajmer. It's relaxing inside compared to some of the other frantic sights in Ajmer. A bonus if you are European - nobody asks for a photograph of you!

title: Unbeleivable
review: It's private museum. Every thing is in golden colour and well preserved. Some religious faith is attached to it.   For tourists separate viewing arrangements are made. Worth a visit.

title: Very boring. Poorly managed actually
review: The place is poorly managed. The management lacks innovation. Lack of signboards explaining things, audio visual aid can make it a bit interesting. As of now it is a very dull and boring place to visit. So apend your time on something better.

title: Beautifull Golden models depicting evolution
review: The models are well designed with great attention paid to detail. The whole creation looks very real as if they will start walking any moment. The place should have basic facilities like toilets as their absence causes inconvenience. Located on the 2nd Floor, the stairway has big stone steps so little inconvenient for elderly citizens. Do visit if in Ajmer.

title: Giant maquette
review: Interesting massive room very richly decorated with Jain tales and motifs. It's a gigantic golden maquette with so many details that after an hour looking around we would still find new characters!

title: Nasiyan Jain Temple-Ajmer
review: visited the place after purchasing Tickets up stairs,it is surrounded by Glass wall and entire arrangement can be seen by all visitors,all the monuments are made of Gold

title: A Jain Temple painted in Gold
review: Nasiyan Jain Temple or Soniji ki Mandir as it is locally called is famous for its Golden interiors. It is a place of tourist and religious attraction. It is situated Near Agra Gate.  It is a visual treat to watch the golden interiors and its artefacts. There are timings for the visit.

title: Unexpected temple
review: Somewhat unexpected for me Jain temple. I got used to the fact that Jain temples, as a rule, are famous for their remarkable and exquisite stone carvings. In this regard Nasiyan temple does not stand out. But it is built of red sandstone and is therefore itself red, which is rare for Jain temples, and consists of two large separate buildings - the main temple and Swarna Nagri behind it, which is sometimes also called the Museum. Swarna Nagri looks luxurious inside. Its walls are decorated with pure gold, inlaid with many precious stones and murals, depicting several episodes from Jain mythology.

title: Universe view
review: It has a beautiful model of the universe as per Jain mythology. The room is filled with amazing creations.

title: Unique sight
review: Definitely worth a visit if you are in Ajmer. It is something that is very different to the other temples or museums and gives a fascinating insight into an alternative worldview.

title: Beautiful Creation
review: It is a wonderful place to visit. A city replica  made of gold ... I think this place gives entrance to Jains only. But if you are a Jain it is like heaven. You must visit to experience it.

title: Imagination well captured of India as a Golden bird
review: This creation of Universe conceptualised and presented with Gold Sheets. Every element and detail is worthy of being studies. How rich could be the imagination is to be seen to believe. A universe build in 1865 that took 25 years to complete.

title: One Of The Best Jain Temple
review: It is among the oldest and best jain temples, i have visited this during my ajmer pushkar trip it is around 2-3 km far from ajmer railway station.

title: Centre of Jainism in Ajmer
review: This sacred place holds the Centre place of faith for the Jain community . The beauty of the structures is astonishing . The vast area represents the rich legacy of the sect in the city . The various Jain monks hold the  sessions of the religion . The entry is restrictedthe keeping the timeline of the place . The sculpture and architecture of the place is unique and worth the visit .

title: Golden Temple of Ajmer - Rajasthan
review: Very nice Temple with Gold plated Replica of Ancient Jainism's Tradition, value and Infrastructure of Ayodhya when was the first Tirthankar takes place.

title: Beautiful jain temple
review: This is beautiful golden temple of Ajmer. This is very attractive place for tourist.when anyone go Ajmer must go This Temple.

title: Must see place - Golden Temple
review: This is a Sacred Place. You can see the Birth Scenes of Rishabadev/Adinath - 1st Thirthankara of Jain all in gold(or gold painted) beautiful shown in gold minatures. You can see the beauty of Holy city of ayodhya. It was such a wonderful place to spend time.

title: Golden museum.
review: About three floored building. It's an excellent museum of Ayodhya. Every detail of ayodhya main downtown of those days. Every article is gold coated. Even walls. Floors platform etc are gold plated. Amazing art work of Indian artizens

title: A must visit in Ajmer
review: Absolute bliss.

title: Soni ji ki Nasiya
review: One would be awestruck by entering this beautiful place and eyes are like glittering gold.Such a beautiful place it is.It reminds us how beautiful our architecture is.Simply loved it.Worth visiting.

title: Beautiful Architecture
review: 15 minutes Walking distance from Dargah.  you must visit the temple. There was a ticket of Rs.10. When you enter second floor you can see a huge city built in gold.

title: Unique Jain Temple
review: At a walk-able distance from the Ajmer Sharif Dargah is the Nasiyan Jain Temple, popularly known as Soniji Temple. The main temple itself is not open for tourists. There is a Hall (Swarna Nagari Hall) behind it which is open to tourists and there is an entrance fee. The hall houses a gold gilded model depicting the Jain cosmology as described by the Jain scriptures.

title: Sparkling golden statues inside the temple
review: Soni ji ki Nassiyan is located near to Railway station, Ajmer. It is a part of Jain temple. Though, you have to follow strict rules and regulations to enter in the main Jain temple, but it is easier to go inside Soniji ki Nassiyan. Inside it, a whole miniature of Kingdom has been placed through small golden statues of elephants, kings, horses, etc. View from double storey is really awesome. Worh visiting

title: Golden glory
review: Have seen nothing like this.  Best 30 mins of my life.  To envision creating a mythical universe in gold and to actually execute it to perfection, i think over 50-60 years ago is just amazing.

title: Great Architecture ... Low maintainance
review: The place is worth a visit but please note that 1. Like most Jain temples, non-Jains are not allowed inside the main temple ; 2. One has to climb at least two storeys to view the great Golden miniature Ayodhya and then another storey to view from the top gallery.

title: Good visit
review: This can be covered in half an hour only.

title: A Jain world-view
review: This temple is in the heart of Ajmer city and has opening-closing timings, so you need to check before going. The temples have some really intricate and beautiful carving and painting on the walls. Inside the steps are steep but it is well worth the climb to see the golden sculptures with which the Jain sect propounds its view of the world as seen by them in ancient times and probably even today. Maintenance could have been better but if someone is visiting Ajmer it is well worth adding this temple-complex in their to see list.

title: a different experience
review: i would not call it a temple as such. rather a museum show casing the various aspects of life. a difficult place for the disabled to reach. should have arrangement for lifts

title: Surprised
review: Surprised by the magnificent golden model of ... heaven?

title: Short visit but quaint.
review: A short trip inside but the scale of the model becomes more impressive as you reach the top floor. Very impressive and only ten rupees.

title: It's a jains golden Temple must visit
review: Very good well maintained Jain Temple must visit to first floor of Temple wit nominal fee full of golden city

title: Beautiful gold relic city
review: Located in the city centre, this should be a must visit for everyone.

title: uniquely beautiful Jain temple
review: I promise you: You have never seen anything like this. The central hall of the temple is a huge sculptural representation of the university, according to Jain cosmology. The details might not be obvious to anyone not already familiar with the texts, but the effect is nevertheless stunning. To my knowledge, there is no similar temple anywhere. In fact, the only site to which it bears any resemblance in The Globe at the World HQ of the Church of Christian Science in Boston.

title: Good Place to see Sculptural Representation
review: Good Place to see Sculptural Representation.

title: Beautiful gold sculptures. Worth a visit
review: Very impressive gold sculptures telling stories from Jain mythology. There are English signs explaining the different scenes but they weren't that clear. Anyway even without understanding the meaning the sculptures are still worth seeing.

title: Awesome display of Jain perspective
review: An unknown jewel, hidden away in Ajmer.  An intricate display of the Jain religions' view of the structure of the Universe.  Have to climb three stories of steep stairs (don't think there was a lift), well worth it.

title: Full Red Temple
review: It is near agra gate in ajmer. This temple is also known as "soni ji ki nasiya temple" and "lal mandir" in ajmer. This place is too famous in ajmer. On back side of this mandir there is "ayodhyanagari" which also a good attraction.

title: Beautiful design
review: We were pleasantly surprised at the beautiful architecture once you are inside the Nasiyan temple. Though one has to climb big stairs to reach the third floor, it was worth the effort.

title: Gold GOld & Gold
review: This temple is more like a museum as it displays the gold things prepaid  by one of the old time business man from Ajmer.

title: Unmatched Architectural Skill !!!
review: This place is rather a Museum (open to all) showcasing mythology as depicted in JAIN epics and literature. Extremely beautiful architectural work, which just cannot be matched these days, tells us STORIES which we may not understand but would certainly appreciate. Gold Smiths and other artisans have done a fabulous job.

title: Soniji ki nasiyan- architecturally rich
review: Its also called Soniji ki nasiyan is an architecturally rich jain temple.it was built in the late nineteenth century.

title: Beautiful Jain Mandir
review: If you are a follower of Jainism this is the place you must visit, if you are not still it is a spiritual place full of knowledge about Jainism and peace. Great architecture and the view is amazing. The model of Mount Sumeru and Ayodhya showing the 5 kalyanaks of Rishabh dev is amazing.

title: Idols of gold
review: A place where the idols of god is made up of gold ...................a big place .............but the security is not appropriate..............

title: Must visit place in Ajmer
review: Nasiyan Jain temple in Ajmer is a must visit temple if you are there.

title: Must visit in Ajmer
review: This is one of the must visit places in Ajmer. Mostly missed by people but I loved the place, the gold plated miniatures are a beautiful sight

title: famous Nasiyan Jain Temple
review: i go there when i am in ajmer..good art show there ..nasiyan jain temple situated on main raod. location is best ...30 minutes is best time for seen. near by railway and bus stand.

title: mesmerising
review: one cant even think in todays world that something like this can be made ,it is so beautiful and nice.

title: Short and insightful trip
review: This venue gives a brief overview of Jain mythology about the evolution of the world with a beautiful display of 3D imagination of the world as per Jain mythology. This 3D model is made of gold. It takes 30 minutes, worth a visit.

title: Not to be missed!
review: The Red Temple's fantastical golden diorama of the ancient world--flat with oceans and continents in concentric circles like bangles--blew our minds! We're told that it took 30 people 20 years to build, all funded by a wealthy Jain family.  One of the least touristy places we visited over the course of three weeks in Rajasthan.

title: Outstanding Swarna Nagari (City of Gold) at Nasiyan Jain is a must see in Ajmer
review: My family visited the Soniji Ki Nasiyan as the Nasiyan Jain Temple is popularly called by the locals (named after the Soni family which built and still maintains the temple)on a cool July afternoon, is an outstanding, one-of-a-kind Jain temple, made unique because of the exquisite "Swarna Nagari" - City of Gold"

title: Beautiful place
review: Nasiyan Jain temple is very beautiful. Creater have put a lot of efforts to get it created. Made of wood with gold plated. Around 150 years old. Very detailed one as per Jain Mythology. Must visit. This is walking distance from station or main hotels.

title: DAZZLING
review: Jain Temple to the layman, the temple is dazzling because of its being completely gold plated.All the sides are protected from footfalls and pollution by huge glass windows. It can be seen and appreciated from different levels and angles because of its being viewed from different  floors, It is a bit hard on the weak and the old but the view from different angles is worth the trouble, It is quite old but retains its beauty and charm.

title: Golden Universe
review: We were stopped in our tracks first by the ornate exterior of the Nasiyan Jain Temple. But even if, as we were, you're only passing through Ajmer, it's worth the visit.

title: WORTH TO SEE
review: This is amazing.There are total 4 floors and this temple can be reviewed from all angles.This is made of Gold and main attraction for Jain's specially

title: Speechless
review: Yes u will b speechless as u enter inside the temple,u will find yourself in city of gold ,this temple is one of a kind ,incredible & peacefull

title: Superb Work!
review: This was not at all on our list. We were on our way to our hotel and we came across this place.At first it looks like an ordinary temple. The board outside says Soniji ki nasiyan  Anyway we decided to visit as we had plenty of time on our hands. But what we saw was amazing. There is a huge model of Swarna Nagari 'City of Gold'. It took 25 years to complete these replicas of Ayodhya and Mt.Sumeru. The whole structure is covered with gold.

title: Beautiful architecture
review: Must visit place in Ajmer. Temple is very beautiful and Serene. Architecture is wonderfully designed and intricately made. The view from all the windows specially the top ones is simply spectacular. Mirror work and gold designed are simple but elegant.

title: Unexpected, magical golden Jain universe
review: Our driver delighted us with an unscheduled stop here. We had no idea what we would be seeing. The golden world represents the Jain vision of the universe. Viewed from two floors in this large hall behind rather smudged glass it is remarkable. It is a temple so remove shows and dress modestly. Steep steps. No elevator.

title: Amazing----
review: Something can not be described in words and it is very relevant in connection with Nasiyan--a superb art and architecture when you will get chance to see it you will realise it-must visit if comes to Ajmer-thanks-SSS-

title: Showcases India's rich cultural and spiritual heritage
review: Built in late nineteenth century, this temple is a must visit for anyone travelling to Ajmer. It depicts the life of Jain Tirthankara in gold plated 3D models. The opulence and peace of this place is something to experience.

title: Nice Cosy place with a different perspective on life
review: The nasiyan is a jain temple where various stages of life are depicted through wooden  carvings and hangings. It is based on jainism concept of life and how it is relevant today.

title: Can be seen only through glass window
review: After seeing the pics i thought i could see the view directly. But you can see only though glass window. Also its far & not so near view from window. But near Dargah so you can visit if visiting dargah for 20 bucks.

title: awesome
review: it is known as the GOLDEN HEAVEN {swarna nagri} with whole depiction of The first god on jains inn gold. great sculptures made of god. it doesn't take much time, but a MUST SEE place. just 10 rs entrance ticket.

title: All gold and spiritual
review: One should visit it. It has well depicted the history and the beliefs of Jainism. The golden architecture will adore you.

title: This will literally make you blind!
review: I went to the temple in search of peace and I found that this temple does not only stores peace but a lotttttt of gold!! There is a structure made of pure gold around the size of a large hall and might have costed some millions to be made...Very very magnificent place....

title: Beautiful Architecture
review: This temple is as beautiful from the inside as from the outside. The serenity and beauty is spellbinding.

title: Place of Worship
review: The temple worshiped by Jains and others. As this got 2 section. Excellent building and place to visit.

title: A must visit....
review: There are two sections of temple and one is reserved for practicing Jains.

title: a wonder
review: you can easily describe this place as wonder of ajmer.

title: A MUST VISIT PLACE
review: being a JAIN, i might exaggerate a little bit. but to be honest, i don't recommend you to visit the temple there. but the museum buit by a very famous rich person from ajmer, Sh. Moolchandji soni. also, the owner of the mewara estate hotel. Its marvellous architecture built of pure gold and crystals. Its worth visiting. it depicts the story of A JAIN GOD, THE FIRST TEERTHANKAR- Bhagwan RISHABHDEV. his birth to MOKSHA. The best thing is to see the fine work with bare hands and in ancient times. Its really difficult to describe it in words here. but i surely recommend.

title: Amazing temple
review: This one is a must visit temple. The gold built model of the world according to the Jain theory is really amazing made up of 1000 kg of gold.

title: Fabulous
review: A must see attraction of Ajmer. Better still, hire a horse cart (tonga) to go there. Indian mythology and religion will be seen with a new twist here. The murals and the other installations are stunning. In any other county you would pay a fortune to see something like this.

title: Super
review: This jain temlpe is master piece of work done by the human being depicting the universe of life cycle and evolution of humanbeing in this life cycle.perfect art of work with gold.appreciate the way universe is shown.you learn great things watching this place about life.

title: Stunning!
review: Many people are not aware of this place. It's a must visit in Ajmer! The exterior totally belies the treasure trove of intricate work inside.

title: Amazing
review: This is not so popular place but definitely one of the best . The architecture is superb and worth a visit

title: Looked beautiful!
review: Didnt get a chance to go in but the temple looked very majestic and stately. Located in the heart of the city, I would have definitely liked to have seen inside.

title: This is called as Soniji ki Nasiyan
review: There is a Jain temple on ground floor with beautiful architecture. The entry is free. On first floor there is a nice models with golden color depicting the stories based on Jain philosophy.

title: Not at all to miss on a Rajasthan Trip
review: Its a model of the ayodha nagri designed for the gods by the gods

title: Interesting
review: The temple is interesting.. however pls note that there are four floors to climb and steep stairs. It can get a bit suffocating and difficult especially for the elderly.

title: Heaven in Gold
review: The visit-able portion of the Private Jain Tempe (Nasiyan) also known as Red Temple or Soniji Ki Nasiyan, has a 3 story high model of Heaven as visualized in Jain manuscripts.

title: Unique Temple
review: nasiyan jain temple is a very unique temple which is made of gold.its a model of the temple to be built,its a very clean place.

title: Awesome place to visit
review: If you want to see some very nice things of Ayodhya nagari this is the best place to visit. very nice, I like it very much. entry fee just Rs 10. also do visit another digambar temple next to this which the people in the temple wont tell you anything abou this, but that is also good

title: The golden coverage
review: The jain temple is popularly known as red temple and behind the temple is the soniji ki nasiyan.The entry fee is Rs.10 per person and you may be the only people inside at any time.Not many people visiting this place.Be prepare small but steep steps.Inside the building huge structures are made with goldan plating viz. ayodhy nagari, one fort etc. You can view these from sealed glass windows.A unique palce and you can spend ½ hour here.

title: Awesome!!!
review: Nice place. Gold plated staffs are the main attractions. Well maintained. Neat and clean. U can spent 15 min here. Its very near to ajmer railway station.

title: Excellant place for travellers of Ajmer
review: Walking distance(from Dargah 15 minutes) you must visit the temple.There was a ticket of Rs.10.When you enter the building there are huge red stone steps and then you walk two storeys up. When you enter  second floor you can see a huge city built in gold. Not sure if gold or gold plated.There are small glass openings throughwhich you can see the city which is built in centre.You can also go to next level and get a top view. The city is made so heautifully and with proper detailing.Liked it, something new. Strongly recommended to visit the temple.

title: Excellent work
review: Fantastic !  Great Art work . representation of great city , golden city of Ayodhya.  Must visit place. Nominal Entry fee to be paid.

title: A unique Temple
review: The structure of this temple looks majestic and really catches your attention. You have to buy entry ticket to enter inside of the temple.

title: Surprisingly interesting place
review: Who would expect a replica of a mythical city gilded in gold to be housed inside a dingy old building. You enter through a side gate, leave your slippers aside and buy a 10 rupee ticket. A watchman with a funny bone directs you up a steep dingy dark staircase. Just when you start having second thoughts, you are confronted with this golden city. You can view the whole replica located in the centre from all angles via glass windows that skirt around it. Boards explaining the concept force you to pay attention to small details. You are drawn into this mysterious world with its fabulous detailing till you are again plunged back down the dingy stairs. Its worth visiting. I am glad nobody told me about it before, preserved the surprise element for me.

title: One of its kind temple
review: This place should be a "Must" visit place in Ajmer. It is located very close to the dargah. The best thing about this temple is the unique way in which Jainism has been depicted using some great structures. The structures are beautiful and there are two floors with multiple windows to overlook these structures from various angles.

title: Very Beautiful Tempe
review: Amazing view and very beautiful temple... Very soulful experience. Take some time out since it will take some time to visit the entire place. Avoid going on a sunny day since the flooring is marble

title: Small piece of History
review: This place is more to understand then only watching. It showed Stages of Jain Tirthankar Lord Adinath.

title: Intellectual peace
review: A beautiful construction, gives a intellectual peace. I was not privileged to visit this city many times but in my one visit I had visited this temple. Really this is good place to spend good time with peace.

title: Just Great!
review: The Museum attached to the Nasiyan Jain Temple is truly something all the Jains from all sects should see. Its beauty and the craftsmanship are truly something cannot be imagined. The temple is also very big and nice and quiet. .

title: Stunning details.
review: This Jain temple was constructed in 1865 AD. and is definitely a sanctum of quietude

title: Must watch
review: This place is very nice place to visit. Miniature architecture is very good. A big empire in a small room.

title: Absolute must visit
review: The place is breathtaking.  I never knew something like this existed.  You need about an hour, pay a nominal Rs. 10 to see this 150 year old great piece or art.  The temple is also quite peaceful and you feel blessed.

title: The charge enterance fee
review: First time in my life that I paid to enter a temple.  I mean who charges to enter gods house.  They have a separate fee to hold ur shoes.  Better leave em in the car.  Lol.  There is nothing's here.

title: Soulful Abode
review: Absolutely wonderful place to be in when your mind is in turmoil. Visit to feel the ambience and serenity of the place. You will feel lost forever in this abode.

title: Amazing
review: A quaint little museum which has Intricate,detailed and mind blowing tableau,a must see place I would say.

title: Beautiful
review: I was suggested by someone to visit it as it was beautiful.After visiting the Ajmer Sharifh Dargah I took a rickshaw to this temple.At the main gate I was stopped and asked if I was Jain as I wasn't I was directed to the other gate which was non Jains.There was a ticket of Rs.10.When you enter the building there are huge red stone steps and then you walk two storeys up. When you enter th second floor you can see a huge city built in gold. Not sure if gold or gold plated.There are small glass openings throughwhich you can see the city which is built in centre.You can also go to next level and get a top view. The city is made so heautifully and with proper detailing.Liked it, something new.

title: Wonderful Museum
review: A great museum that has a stunning piece of art on show. A great introduction to Jainism and a magnificent display of art.

title: One time visitors for foreigners
review: It is a nice temple for one time visitors. No such amusing place. Admirer of arts and temple lover can go there to pay a visit. Not very far from Ajmer bustand and Railway station. It will take an hour to completely visit this temple.

title: Too much hype for nothing
review: went to visit coz 25 min walk from our hotel and nothing to do...went in with a lot of expectations....too much of gold around.....not maintained properly....we were the only tourists....had to climg steep stairs with lot of graffitti on the walls to see the whole hall of various statues..not very impressive...

title: A Remarkable Museum
review: After paying a stipend as entry fee you proceed up a dingy dark staircase to the exhibit room. The display is in a small hall and encased is glass. you view it through the window ports. On the walls are plaques explaining the whole legendary mythology surrounding the display. The display is a masterpiece of artwork. A miniature gilded city unimaginably beautifully crafted with buildings, animals and figurines. most astonishing! Make sure to go up to the top level for a view from above. For the payment of 10 rupees - wow !!!

title: Unknown attraction in Ajmer
review: Ajmer is known for the Durgah and Pushkar...but this Jain temple should also not to be missed.

title: Very beautiful place to see the design of models and concepts
review: Very beautiful place to see the design of models and concepts. They have Jain concept in design of model and it looks very beautiful. 30 to 40 mins good enough time to spend in this place. You should go to this place in Ajmer.

title: don't miss it
review: main temple is nice  and made of red stone with a very large  main chamber--- is an architecturally rich & excellent.many gold plated wooden figure and depicting of many figure of Jain religion.

title: Impressive
review: This "big miniature" of one of the Jain world is the size of a building, fully gold. Explaination are short, simple and help to understand a bit of the Jain culture.

title: Best part is architecture
review: The pathway is really great. Once you walk through the pathway and reach the temple premises , the feeling you get after seeing the idol is really a great part. Can say that don't ever miss this place in your Ajmer plan

title: Awesome
review: The temple is open to visitors of all religions year round for a very small entry fee.  In front of the gateway is the marble staircase, leading to the main temple.  The double-storey main chamber has several gold-plated wooden figures, depicting Jain Tirthankars.  In the hall behind the temple, one sees the depiction of the Jain concept of the ancient world, with 13 continents and oceans, the intricate golden city of Ayodhya, flying peacock and elephant gondolas, and gilded elephants with many tusks.  There is a lot of decorative work using gold, silver and precious stones.  There is a library of rare Jain scriptures which are still used for research by scholars.  Worth a visit.

title: Fine for a short visit
review: This is said to be small replica of Ayodhya nagri. It depicts marvellous architecture of mythological Ramrajya along with flying planes of those times. This miniature model is contained in single room only and takes hardly 5 minutes to complete the visit.

title: So beautiful..! Must Must watch
review: What an architecture. You will fall in love at 1st sight. Believe me. Great work . One of the best place that you wont find any other part of the world.

title: Must visit
review: Very near to railway station

title: A Jain Temple
review: A two storied Nasiyan Jain Temple was built in 1865 and is also known as Lal Mandir (Red Temple). The Temple is dedicated to Lord Adinath, the first jain Tirthankar. The temple belongs to Digambar Sector. A nice visit.

title: splendour
review: This is a vast area designed as a park with its huge Jain Temple as the center of attraction. Walking up to the Temple there are small stalls displaying aspects, facts, history of the Jain religion. Constructed from mostly the very common sandstone and marble from Rajasthan the venue impresses with its splendor of beauty and soberness. Please obey their wish to take no photos of the Temple.

title: Nice Place in Ajmer
review: The Nasiyan temple elaborates everything about Jainism, their beliefs and their resemblance to other religions. The temple is very very quiet and peaceful, very beautiful, but with huge steps, and high stairs, which would be problematic for old age people.

title: UNIQUE!
review: it consists of jain temple and back side is a big hall which consists of jain history and religion shown in small and big sculptures and monuments all made in real gold. theres lot of gold put in it, which makes it unique and , the place consists of temple . The worship of idols is permitted to Jain only. but the prayer and view the monuments is free for all. Temple visit is free but there is 10 bucks ticket to view the Nasiyan behind temple. Remains open till 5.pm.

title: Nice but no entry to temple
review: We loved the set up, it looks like a scene from a dream but as we're not a part of the jain religion we weren't allowed access to the rest of the temple.

title: An undervalued attraction in Ajmer
review: If in Ajmer i would definitely recommend stopping here for a look; the temple is located on the road that leads out of Ajmer to Pushkar and is a fabulous testament to Indian craftsmanship. You have to see the gold sculptures to appreciate the beauty of it. It is also one of the least crowded attraction you will see in India with a nominal entrance fee.

title: Holy visit
review: Being a Jain and connected to the owner of the temple, I usually go to this place for my prayers.

title: Good place to stay if Any jain is with you
review: Good Rooms Available for Jain;s only.. with Good Home Kind Food at Bhojanshala. But Please Confirm Befor Going because They allow only any one i forget ( Digamber or Shwetamber) Jains to stay. And Charges are also very Low Coz After the Minimum Charge it is upto you How Much you want to Donate.

title: excellent place
review: must visit this place and it is really good concept and imaginery.

title: Hidden treasure of Ajmer
review: If you are in Ajmer then you definitely should not miss this place. In this temple you can see the life of Jain Tirthankar Rhushabdev right from his birth until he attains Moksha. It took 35 years to build this. Its fine and detailed work and all of it in Gold and shades of gold. The entire place is well maintained and there are details mentioned in English and Hindi.

title: Soniji ki Nasiyan
review: Soniji ki Nasiyan is a Jain temple. It took more than 30 years to build. It provides the view of universe from the Jain point of view. It shows the life of Lord Rishabhdev. It shows the three scenes in three dimensions with gold plated sculptures as per the Jain philosophy. The quality of craftsmanship shown is exquisite and worth seeing for any one. It also houses accommodation for people from Jain faith only. It is on the way to Pushkar in Ajmer. Fort built by Akbar is close to it.

title: Good temple but need attention
review: Its a very beautiful temple made of Gold and is inside the glass room. The walls outside the glass doors are not maintained, people have written all nonsense on the walls, Temple authorities charges you Rs.10 for each person, but don't use that money in uplift of temple. The glasses are dirty, hiding the view of temple most of the time,

title: Waste of time. Over rated
review: Ntn great abt the place.

title: Muse see
review: Never knew about this before coming over. Was a marvellous sight as the full temple is made from gold and depicts life stories of Jain gods. I could not understand the full story, nevertheless it is an awesome place and worth the visit once.

title: nice to see!
review: it is a nice place to see

title: Must see attraction
review: Don't miss this if you are in ajmer.the view from first floor and second floor is different.it also called sony ki nasiyan.

title: Must Visit in Ajmer.......
review: Temple is gold plated and it is about meru parbat. In jain religion.

title: Amazing
review: Good experience. one can spend about an hour here viewing the whole story in golden structures. Not more to say about this place.

title: Wonderful Gold art in Jain Temple
review: This is a marvelous gold design example in Ajmer, beautiful work done. So gergeous & appreciable but very few people know, Normally people goes ajmer for Darga Shariff Dharshan & Puskar Temple- Lord Bramaji Dharshan but you need to add This Jain Temple dharshan in your plan.

title: Really amazing
review: This is probably the best place to visit in Ajmer if you are not religious minded.

title: Soniyaji ki Nasiyan
review: One Should visit; Jain temple and having near and clean. Very narrative about how world and life (Say birth and rebirth) born and reborn.

title: Hidden gem, must visit
review: What a wonderful place, such a delight. We reached there almost by accident. on inquiring in Ajmer, about the attractions of the city, one shopkeeper mentioned this temple.

title: Nice Place
review: A must place to visit when you are in Ajmer, complete scale jain temple with all the prehistoric assembly shown.

title: Nice work
review: The demonstrations on the inside are very beautiful. The area in which it lies is very crowded and needs more maintenance.

title: a great shrine!
review: it was wonderful to visit the jain temple. i went with my parents and they were quite excited to explore the worship place of another religion.

title: Built in 19th Century but quite modern
review: It would be quite ordinary to say that this is a very beautiful temple. Its just magnificent but quite looking.

title: Fascinating!
review: Ajmer is not the most exciting town in Rajasthan and initially, I was worried we would not have enough to keep us busy while waiting for the bus to Udaipur. The visit to this temple totally proved me wrong! I don't know much about the Jain religion and this was truly eye-opening. It's so huge it always appears empty, so I would recommend sitting on one of the steps and just taking a break from all the hustle and bustle outside. The diorama, presenting the basic elements of the religion and the gods is simply stunning - and you need quite a bit of time to take it all in. I also took some great pictures from the windows on the last floor. My only regret - I wish I were more familiar with the religion in order to really benefit from this experience!

title: Museum
review: Only jains allowed to worship. Museum is open for all. Small museum with story of jainism. Can go only if nothing else to do

title: Golden Temple of Ajmer
review: The sluptures were coated in a bright golden metal to resemble like gold.

title: sone ka madir
review: it is a jain temple though how are their temples was difficult to understand the gold coverings are awsome  ,it was more of a museum ,being in the midst of the city near rly station,it needs more maintenance but in Ajmer a must visit

title: Under maintained
review: This is a beautiful place. But I really do hope that maintained it better. The displays are dusty and are in urgent need for some cleaning.

title: Masterpiece
review: We were there on a day trip at Ajmer through morning evening shatabdi and the main agenda was to visit Ajmersharif dargah. I got to know about this place through trip advisor and when I had some time after our visit, thought that we should give this a try. After entering the place by paying an entry fee of 10 per head, we went through the stairs up and reached the first floor from where we could see this whole intricate masterpiece. Truly amazing stuff and great detailing. I would seriously recommend this to all people who visit Ajmer.

title: Nasiyan Jain Temple
review: Ajmer Jain Temple, also known as Soniji Ki Nasiyan, is an architecturally rich Jain temple.The main chamber, known as the Swarna Nagari "City of Gold", has several gold-plated wooden figures, depicting several figures in the Jain religi

title: Absolutely Stunning!
review: The beauty of the work cannot be described in words. The gold and copper all around is dazzling. There is not a great deal to see in Amjer but this is certainly worth the visit. You will not be disappointed.

title: more like a museum
review: nice, a lot of gold figures to see, but looks more like a museum then a temple. Not highly recommendable. Go to the old city and stroll around the mosque.... have a tea somewhere and enjoy!.

title: must visit place. the musuem behind the temple is a must see.
review: must visit place. the musuem behind the temple is a must see place. It e plains the belief of jainism relegion.

title: A hidden stunning marvel!
review: Ajmer for me was famous for the Dargah and to a lesser extent the Anna Sagar, so it was quite by accident that I stumbled upon the Soni Ji ki Nasiyan. Revered by the Digamber sect of the Jains, an official acquaintance, recommended that I took a look at this red Jain Temple. A 10 rupee entrance fee on entering doused out all my religious fervor. How could a temple charge you for entering its premise?? But as soon as I made my way up along the steep winding stairs, I was completely taken aback. It is a misnomer to call it a temple, it is actually a museum. The breathtakingly beautiful work of gold, silver, copper and glass mosaic that depict the Jain philosophy of the creation of the world is mesmerizing and is truly a stunning marvel.

title: great structure
review: great place.the whole temple is built of gold they say.beautiful structure.the jain beliefs are all scripted in there.one should not miss.it wont take much of time either.

title: Jainism and its aspects
review: The whole place is a great place to learn the teachings of the Jain religion and I was fortunate enough to have accompanied with a friend to this place who knew a bit about the place and proved to be a great help at the place. Even though one would not find it difficult to understand the teachings and values of the place since they have carvings and works all around depicting various events and teachings. The whole place is a beauty and there is a lot of eye pleasing works here. For a very cheap price you could even buy a book that has all the information and the photographs of the place. The place is worth a visit.

title: good place to see
review: this one is a wonder in the manner it is made. We had a walk around to see the temple and the creativity in the making of this temple is remarkable.

title: I liked it most in ajmer
review: After I have visited all the major tourist attraction in ajmer like dargah sharif, pushkar temple, lake. I like it most - nasiyan jain temple. It also called as "soni ji ki nasiya". They have shown the origin of jain religion through models and objects. This whole model looks vivacious, its like a big old city with forts, rajmahal, king with his army, greenery all arround, gods flying in sky on there vehicle, it is placed in a big hall and you could see inside through glass window.

title: New experience for foreigners in a Jain temple
review: This was my first visit to a Jain temple. It was different. So it was a new experience for me. Especially if you are not from India and you want to explore diverse Indian culture and religion, this temple is a must visit. In ajmer, you  will have enough time so it is highly unlikely that you will miss this due to lack of time. One way you may plan the visit  is when you head towards the Ana sagar lake from the  Ajmer fort that houses the museum. It is in walking distance from the fort. So you may stroll down the road. The  brown coloured structure is easy to find. The admission fee is just nominal. It does not take more than 15-20 minutes to go around the temple. What is amazing about it that all the work done in gold and copper  has to be seen through a transparent walls  and viewing pores. The celstial sky and  the world with numerous figures are worthwhile watching. Recommend to any one visiting Ajmer. You will not be disappointed.

title: Cannot be described in words
review: This was our third vist and of all the attractions at Ajmer (besides the Dargah), this was the only visit we squeezed in the short time we had.

title: Beautiful Model
review: The 'models' are nice and the two levels of viewing, both almost 360 degrees, give different perspectives. Some good paintings were available in the on-campus shop.

title: should visit once
review: when I searched about ajmer I found, Nasiyan Jain temple as attraction. First I thought its basically a temple. but when I reached there. I found myself wrong. it was more than a simple temple. there's a HUGE miniature display of MAHABHARAT period. everything  painted in golden colour. giving a feel of made of gold. nothing much to do but should visit this place once.

title: Magnificent
review: The model (huge !) of Jain Philosophy has to be seen to be believed - It is magnificent and beautiful : I found this place almost by accident, and was glad I did

title: The best kept secret of Ajmer !
review: This is one of its kind attraction. One will be taken by surprise by the beauty of this place and the detailing that has gone into its making. Sadly, its not publicised much. Information about the depicts are put up on the boards but it will add great value if guides are available. This over 110 years old attraction should be a must visit while at Ajmer. Its close to the railway station too.

title: I hope it doesn't get very popular
review: It is a surprise that something as beautiful as the Nasiyan Jain Temple is not that famous among tourists. And that is partly what makes it this amazing. Not much crowd, not too commercialized, peaceful and serene.

title: ayodhya scene magical
review: this was unexpected treasure in the city... the temple has a out of the world ayodhya scene which has been put together in a huge hall and can be seen from windows strategically placed.. the stairs are quite tough to climb especially for elders but the view of the whole scene make up for the special climb..

title: The best art temple of jainsim
review: with out visitsing Nsiyan Jain temple our visit to Ajmeer will be incomplete.  Please visit the Temple along with your Family members and Friends to enjoy the beauty of the temple,the temple is well maintined by the staff.

title: Centrally located but just average
review: Excellent depiction of heaven and earth using nice imagery. Hundreds of small idols of Soldiers, War horses, Elephants, Wedding and was processions. Dozens of windows to view from all around.

title: Great place
review: It was really a great experience to visit this temple. It clearly depicts that India has still got the refine talent of making such a beautiful temple which brings peace and soothing effect in all visitors . It is way better that all those known temples where on the name of prayer money is asked . I loved this place.

title: Outstanding  creation of samovasaran
review: A must visit place for all jains.it's popular as soni ji ki nasiyan.it's a re creation of a phase when God(tirthankar) addresses the masses.

title: Awe Inspiring
review: This is a must visit in Ajmer, besides the dargah. Had we not known or read about it beforehand, we would have surely missed it.

title: nice timepass
review: known as soni ji nasiyan, its a nice jain temple.you can go around and click pics within 15mins.the walls inside are worn down but u can still take some pretty pictures.

title: Nothing much
review: Only interesting thing was hearing someone literally say: "The world is flat, it is true!" The temple itself is closed to the public, but a maquette of the Jain universe is on display.

title: Should go there at least once
review: Basically, it's a jain temple. situated in the heart of city. Very ordinary from outside, but worth visiting once if you are in Ajmer.

title: awesome must do
review: while in ajmer your trip is incomplete without a visit to the nasiyan jain temple. It has got a amazing display of lord Rishabdev bitrh to nirvana stages in a miniature form with all golden display . you have to see it to believe it

title: a trip to jainism
review: it is very gd place to review and come a little closer to jainism a very gd temple and attached an excellent museum which has chariots and other monuments which shows history of jainism . a must visit place for those who plan to visit dargah shariff ajmer

title: It was the surprise
review: This one is never miss kind of place. It is Digambar Jain Temple with gorgeous work on Lord Adinath (the first path setter in Jainism). All work is in copper and gold. It is massive. approximately 40 feet high and 80 feet wide. It shows 3 important incidents in the life of Lord Adinath and work is just amazing. It is must visit place in Ajmer.

title: A bit hard to find until suddenly
review: I figured out I was at the back of the building-- walked around and entered the Red Jain Temple with it's detailed presentation of Jain creation story.  I would have preferred a single price (rather than another few rupees for the shoes, the pamphlet, etc) but that is the way things are done in this part of India.  Nice markets and shops close by.

title: See this if you are in Ajmer.
review: In the building behind the main temple is housed the huge gold leaf model telling stories from Jain manuscripts. Thousands of intricate parts go towards the telling of the story. I loved the airships and the procession of Celestials. The room housing the models is quite large, and you can see it through windows all round the upper part of the building ie you look down on the model. To visit this diorama costs 10Rp, and you can buy a little book with photos and a brief history for 15Rp from the ticket office. This is most definitely worth a visit.

title: Over hyped
review: It was good but not well lit too crowded and noisy and dity surrounding specially in midst of traffic

title: Visit if possible, good to see the architecture layout
review: Since,there's not much to do at Ajmer we thought to visit this temple but unlike other temple this has an entrance fee of Rs. 10 - 15 which is okay. You need to climb two floors & you can see the miniature layout of the huge palace.. its good to see the detailing of each & every miniature.. from elephants, to people dancing, playing music... it is sort of an imaginery world created.. all in gold color.

title: Mind boggling: sci-fi meets spirituality
review: This is another example of how India makes you realize that however surprise saturated you are, there is room for another. This unpromising building from the outside houses this incredible diorama of the multi-universal Jain order, mostly in gold and precious stones. It is huge and can be viewed from different sides and different heights. I loved the floating gold gondolas with baubles hanging off them.

title: Very Impressive
review: I am not very clear as to what it is all about, having being deposited suddenly at the entrance of this "monument" by my taxi driver. As was my visit to the Dargah, this was even more lonely, as I was the only person in the premises in that time (about 10 am). Bit scary.. being in a tourist in a place which was totally devoid of tourists!! But anyway, the display and models are very very impressive, and certainly worth a dekko.

title: Wierd and wonderful
review: 10R's gets you a trip into the Jain world of the universe. Quite magical and thought provoking.

title: Very nice
review: Very clean. Visited twice. Camera and photography was not allowed there. Must place to visit in Ajmer.

title: Weird, Interesting architecture
review: The compound has two parts, once actual Temple and the back side is a kind of museum. The museum has replicas showing the story of the world of Jains. The replicas are all in gold and magnificently done. The downside is that the place is not managed at all.

title: A beautiful temple
review: This is a not to be missed site while visiting Ajmer.

title: very quite relaxing
review: this is a Jain temple situated in middle of city still quite n relaxing place.

title: Not to be missed.
review: It is a three dimensional "fantasy" of the Jain Universe with wonderful gilded wooden sculptures encompassing the three stories of the building. The walls are faced with with the finest Belgian  glass.

title: A monument worthy to be a UNESCO Heritage site
review: This temple situated on Prithviraj Rd, Ajmer, also known as Soniji ka Jain Mandir, has an amazing hall containing a goldwork of 500 kg gold depicting various scenes of Heaven etc including some of the Raj motifs. While the gold work is just fascinating, mirror work competes for the excellence too. It's a must-see in Ajmer. Photography is allowed.

title: Wonderful experience
review: Wow, Its great to see the place. If one visits Ajmer, the place is must be visited.

title: Well worth a visit
review: The Jain temple can only be visited by those of the Jain religion. However the museum is open to all. There is a nominal entrance fee of 10 rupees. As there are English explanations throughout, you get a good understanding of the religion and the gold miniature creation has to be seen to be believed. An excellent way to spend an hour.

title: impressive modelling and gold work, and symbolic story telling
review: quiet calm, almost empty, cheap admission charge and helpful booklet. well worth an hour of time.A guide would have been really appreciated!

title: Brilliant
review: Only believers can enter the temple but exterior is glorious. The real attraction is the Jain model of the universe. Gilded figure, animals and buildings. Quite remarkable.

title: Unique and beautiful
review: This Jain temple is a worth visit place. It has very beautiful gold - plated artistic work. It was peaceful and nearly empty. The description of the models and art work was displayed very well. You would not need a guide. Highly recommended.

title: Unexpected beautiful golden sculptures
review: The temple itself is not able to be viewed unless you are a Jain believer.  Access is from  a street corner. The temple caretaker did give us permission to take a photo from the outside.

title: A decent place to visit
review: Also known as Soni Ji ki Nasiya. There is a temple only for Jain people and a museum for all. The museum has a world miniature made from gold. It's a quiet place having very low entrance fee.

title: Beautiful temple
review: I was delighted to see this temple.It is a wonderful example of traditional jain temple architecture.

title: Can only visit the Museum not the temple if your not Jain
review: A must see museum next to the Temple, a great work of craftsmanship to create the entire display, check visiting hours.

title: A must visit in Ajmer
review: This is a beautiful recreation of the golden city of Ayodhaya depicting birth of Lord Rishbhavdev and celebrations.

title: A short visit to understand the origins of Jainism
review: Soni ji ki nasiya is situated in the heart of Ajmer city at about 2 kms from the railway station. Can be very easily accessed through public transportation. Entrance fees is 10 Rupees. You need to take off your shoes at the entrance. There is a designated person to take care of your shoes and they charge Re 1 for each pair of shoes.

title: Well worth a visit
review: The Jain temple can only be visited by those of the Jain religion. However the museum is open to all. There is a nominal entrance fee of 10 rupees. As there are English explanations throughout, you get a good understanding of the religion and the gold miniature creation has to be seen to be believed. An excellent way to spend an hour.

title: impressive modelling and gold work, and symbolic story telling
review: quiet calm, almost empty, cheap admission charge and helpful booklet. well worth an hour of time.A guide would have been really appreciated!

title: Unique and beautiful
review: This Jain temple is a worth visit place. It has very beautiful gold - plated artistic work. It was peaceful and nearly empty. The description of the models and art work was displayed very well. You would not need a guide. Highly recommended.

review: Only believers can enter the temple but exterior is glorious. The real attraction is the Jain model of the universe. Gilded figure, animals and buildings. Quite remarkable.

review: The temple itself is not able to be viewed unless you are a Jain believer.  Access is from  a street corner. The temple caretaker did give us permission to take a photo from the outside.

review: Also known as Soni Ji ki Nasiya. There is a temple only for Jain people and a museum for all. The museum has a world miniature made from gold. It's a quiet place having very low entrance fee.

title: Beautiful temple
review: I was delighted to see this temple.It is a wonderful example of traditional jain temple architecture.

title: Can only visit the Museum not the temple if your not Jain
review: A must see museum next to the Temple, a great work of craftsmanship to create the entire display, check visiting hours.

review: Soni ji ki nasiya is situated in the heart of Ajmer city at about 2 kms from the railway station. Can be very easily accessed through public transportation. Entrance fees is 10 Rupees. You need to take off your shoes at the entrance. There is a designated person to take care of your shoes and they charge Re 1 for each pair of shoes.

review: This is a beautiful recreation of the golden city of Ayodhaya depicting birth of Lord Rishbhavdev and celebrations.
